medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe, crampy epigastric abdominal pain radiating to the back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain started around 3 AM today, awakening the patient from sleep. The pain has been severe and crampy in nature, has not ceased since onset but has improved after morphine. The patient had a prior episode of crampy epigastric pain after a fatty meal about 1 week prior, which lasted only 1.5 hours and was not severe.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Sleep apnea, plantar fasciitis, left Achilles tendon tear, gout, history of heartburn, nephrolithiasis, diverticulitis, and status post laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy.
medical_history.family_history: Father has a history of hypertension and stroke; mother is living, brother is healthy.
medical_history.social_history: Non-smoker, does not regularly drink alcohol (last drink was 1 beer a week ago), started taking an herbal supplement to curb appetite last week (unsure of contents), exercises regularly by walking several miles twice a week, and attempts to eat healthy.
